intro: Dendrocnide costata, commonly known as the serrated stinging nettle, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Urticaceae and is characterized by its finely serrated leaves and stinging hairs. The plant produces small, greenish flowers arranged in clusters, and it thrives in moist, shaded environments. Its stinging hairs contain irritants that cause skin irritation upon contact. Dendrocnide costata is often found in rainforests and is part of the diverse flora of the Australian continent.
